litematica.config.generic.comment.easyPl:
The type of "accurate placement protocol" to use.
- Auto: Uses v3 in single player, and by default Slabs-only in multiplayer,
  unless the server has Carpet mod that sends a 'carpet:hello'
  packet, in which case v2 is used on that server.
- Version 3: Only supported by Litematica itself (in single player) or with Servux.
- Version 2: Compatible with servers with the Carpet mod
  (either QuickCarpet by skyrising and DeadlyMC,
  or CarpetExtra in addition to FabricCarpet.
  And in both cases the 'accurateBlockPlacement' Carpet rule needs
  to be enabled on the server).
- Slabs only: Only fixes top slabs. Compatible with Paper servers.
- None: Does not modify coordinates.
litematica.config.generic.comment.pasteN:
Whether or not the NBT data of blocks is attempted to be restored,
and which method is used for that.
- Place & Data Modify will try to place the "NBT-picked" block
  near the player, and then use the data modify
  command to transfer the NBT data to the setblock'ed block
- Place & Clone will try to place the "NBT-picked" block
  near the player, and then clone it to the final location.
- Teleport & Place will try to teleport the player nearby and then
  directly place the NBT-picked item in the correct position.
Note that the teleport & place method doesn't currently work correctly/at all.
The recommended method is §ePlace & Data Modify§r, however for that to work
you will probably need to lower the pasteCommandLimit to 1 per tick and increase
the pasteCommandInterval to 1-4 ticks or something.
Thus you should only use this for pasting important blocks that need the data,
for example by making a schematic of just the inventories,
and then paste that with replace behavior set to None.
litematica.config.generic.comment.pasteR:
The behavior of replacing existing blocks
in the Paste schematic tool mode
litematica.config.generic.comment.placem:
The block replace behavior when adding blocks
to the schematic world.

This allows using overlapped placements without the
later handled placement always overwriting earlier ones with air.
On the other hand some blocks like light blocks are considered
to be air, so they would need the "All" replace behavior
to get placed at all.

Selects which type of warning message to show (if any)
when either the Easy Place mode or Placement Restriction prevent placing a block
litematica.config.generic.comment.select: The Area Selection corners mode to use (Corners, or Expand)
litematica.config.generic.comment.custom:
If enabled, then the directory set in 'customSchematicBaseDirectory'
will be used as the root/base schematic directory,
instead of the normal '.minecraft/schematics/' directory

The root/base schematic directory to use,
if 'customSchematicBaseDirectoryEnabled' is enabled
litematica.config.generic.comment.areaSe:
Use per-world or server root directories for the area selections
§6NOTE: Don't switch this OFF while you are live streaming,
§6as then the Area Selection browser will show the server IP
§6in the navigation widget and also in the current selection name/path
§6until you change the current directory and selection again
litematica.config.generic.comment.better:
If enabled, then the schematic rendering is done
by injecting the different render call into the vanilla
rendering code. This should result in better translucent block
rendering/ordering and schematic blocks not getting rendered
through the client world blocks/terrain.
If the rendering doesn't work (for example with Optifine),
try disabling this option.
litematica.config.generic.comment.change:
If true, then the selected corner of an area selection
is always set to the last moved corner,
when using the set corner hotkeys
litematica.config.generic.comment.cloneA:
If enabled, then using the Clone Selection hotkey will create
the placement at the original area selection position,
instead of at the player's current position
litematica.config.generic.comment.comman:
If enabled, then command feedback is automatically disabled
and then re-enabled for multiplayer Paste, Fill and Delete operations
(which are using /setblock and /fill commands) by disabling and then
re-enabling the sendCommandFeedback game rule when the task is finished

The maximum size/volume of each individual box
that can be filled via the command-based Fill/Delete
operations. Bigger areas/volumes will get split to multiple commands.
All areas are also split to per-chunk boxes at first anyway.

Disables dividing the fill volumes (in the Fill, Replace and Delete modes)
to per-chunk boxes

Maximum number of commands sent per game tick,
when using the Paste, Fill and Delete features on a server,
where they will use setblock and fill commands.
Note that he Paste feature can overshoot this by a couple of commands
when using the NBT restore functionality, which needs two additional commands for each block.

The clone command name to use when using the
command-based creative mode functionality on servers.
This is currently only used by the Paste function if the NBT restore
behavior is set to 'Place & Clone'.

The fill command name to use when using the
command-based creative mode functionality on servers

The setblock command name to use when using the
command-based creative mode functionality on servers,
namely the Paste Schematic in World function

The summon command name to use when using the
command-based creative mode functionality on servers,
namely the Paste Schematic in World function

The interval in game ticks the Paste, Fill and Delete tasks
are executed at. The commandLimitPerTick config sets the maximum
number of commands to send per execution, and this config
sets the interval in game ticks before the next execution.

If enabled, instead of using the configured setblock and fill commands,
the World Edit //pos1, //pos2 and //set commands are used.
Note that using World Edit commands is around 3x slower
than using vanilla commands due to the command limit per tick,
and WE requiring multiple commands per block or area (//pos1 //pos2 //set).
§6WARNING: The paste replace behavior option WILL NOT WORK if using
§6the World Edit commands and fill volumes instead of individual setblock commands!
Thus it's recommended to use the vanilla commands, if you have the permission to run them.
One other thing that might make you prefer WE commands in some cases
is that they can prevent block updates, if the server doesn't have
the Carpet mod and thus the '/carpet fillUpdates false' rule available.
litematica.config.generic.comment.debugL:
Enables some debug log messages in the game console,
for debugging certain issues or crashes.
litematica.config.generic.comment.datafi:
The configurable data fixer level to apply to loaded schematics.
This option can improve performance of loading
schematics by bypassing the Vanilla Data Fixer,
but this can also cause severe data loss if it is disabled.

Default Schema Value for the Vanilla Data Fixer

Used to adjust the lowest possible value, and the value used
when the loaded schematic does not contain this information.

§6WARNING:  This setting is meant to be used at the direction
§6from a Litematica developer such as masa themselves.
§6When in doubt, keep the default for Minecraft 1.12.
litematica.config.generic.comment.easyPl:
This causes the Easy Place mode to place the first/closest block
you are looking at first, instead of the furthest/bottom-most block.
Setting this to false allows you to place multiple layers "at once",
since the furthest blocks would be placed before the closer ones block the line of sight.

When enabled, then you can hold down the use key
and look at different schematic blocks to place them,
without having to click on every block individually.

When enabled, then simply trying to use an item/place a block
on schematic blocks will place that block in that position

If enabled, then Litematica handles the so called
"Carpet mod Accurate Block Placement Protocol" itself in single player.
This is recommended to be kept enabled if you
are going to use Easy Place in single player.

The interval in milliseconds the Easy Place mode waits
after swapping inventory slots and placing a block.
Useful to avoid placing wrong blocks when having high ping.

If enabled, reduces reach distance from 6 to 4.5
so servers don't reject placement of far blocks.
litematica.config.generic.comment.entity:
Use the Entity Data Sync protocol from Servux
to obtain Entity Data from the server

Use the Vanilla NBT Query method when Servux
is not available.  This method requires Operator Privileges.
litematica.config.generic.comment.execut:
Require holding an enabled tool item
for the executeOperation hotkey to work
litematica.config.generic.comment.fixChe: Enable a fix to the broken chest mirror code in vanilla
litematica.config.generic.comment.fixRai:
If true, then a fix is applied for the vanilla bug in rails,
where the 180 degree rotations of straight north-south and
east-west rails rotate 90 degrees counterclockwise instead >_>
litematica.config.generic.comment.genera:
If enabled, then by default the suggested schematic names
will be lowercase and using underscores instead of spaces
litematica.config.generic.comment.highli:
When enabled, highlights the item (including Shulker Boxes containing it)
of the looked at block in the schematic
litematica.config.generic.comment.itemUs:
Bypass the new distance/coordinate check that was added in 1.18.2.

That check breaks the "accurate placement protocol" and causes
any blocks placed with a rotation (or other property) request to just become ghost blocks.

There is basically no need to ever disable this.
The check didn't even exist ever before 1.18.2.
litematica.config.generic.comment.layerM:
If true, then the render layer follows the player.
Note: This currently collapses Layer Range type ranges unfortunately
litematica.config.generic.comment.loadEn:
If true, then the entire schematic is always loaded at once.
If false, then only the part that is within the client's view distance is loaded.
litematica.config.generic.comment.materi: When enabled, the exact block state is ignored, and only the block type needs to match
litematica.config.generic.comment.pasteA: This forces using the fill command (instead of setblock) even for single blocks
litematica.config.generic.comment.pasteI:
If enabled, then block entities ae not pasted at all
via the command-based pasting in multiplayer.
This allows you to easier paste in two passes if you
want to use the NBT-restore option for inventories etc. in the second pass,
which usually requires a lot slower pasting speed/command rate.

If enabled, then all block entities are ignored from the fill
commands when pasting. This allows them to get pasted individually,
which is required if the NBT restore option is being used.

If enabled, then the command limit is ignored when pasting
blocks with a block entity with the NBT restore option enabled.
This seems to somehow fix an issue where the NBT restore
would otherwise fail for many blocks with a low command rate.
If enabled, then the Paste feature will not paste any entities
Don't paste inventory contents when pasting a schematic
litematica.config.generic.comment.pasteT:
If enabled, then instead of actually pasting schematics to the world,
they are written as setblock commands into text files.
litematica.config.generic.comment.pasteU:
If enabled, then instead of only using individual /setblock commands,
the command-based Paste operation (which is used on servers)
will also try to use /fill commands for any continuous areas of the same block.
This has no effect in single player, since the mod sets the blocks directly
in the integrated server's world in and doesn't use commands at all.

This is a temporary hack workaround to use the command-based pasting
also in single player, which allows using the render layer limited
pasting in single player, which currently doesn't work with
the direct world access pasting that single player normally uses.

Note that this will have all the same NBT data restoration
limitations that multiplayer pasting has normally.

Use Servux to paste a schematic directly to the server.
This method is much faster than the traditional
command-based method, and it supports restoring
Entity NBT Data.
litematica.config.generic.comment.pickBl: Avoids replacing any damageable items in the hotbar

Avoids replacing any tool items in the hotbar.

This means any items that extend the vanilla ToolItem class.

Enables the schematic world pick block hotkeys.
There is also a hotkey for toggling this option to toggle those hotkeys... o.o

If enabled, then if the required item for the pick bloc
is not found directly in the player's inventory, but there
is a Shulker box that contains it, the Shulker Box
will be switched to the player's hand instead

The hotbar slots that are allowed to be
used for the schematic pick block
litematica.config.generic.comment.placem:
When enabled, the use key can only be used
when holding the correct item for the targeted position,
and the targeted position must have a missing block in the schematic
litematica.config.generic.comment.render:
Whether or not the material list should
be rendered inside GUIs

Removes the timeout from the rendering worker threads.
If you get very stuttery rendering when moving around
or dealing with large schematics, try disabling this. It will however make
the schematic rendering a lot slower in some cases.
litematica.config.generic.comment.server: Limit request rate for server entity data syncer
litematica.config.generic.comment.signTe: Automatically set the text in the sign GUIs from the schematic
litematica.config.generic.comment.toolIt: The item to use as the "tool" for selections etc.
If true, then the "tool" item can be used to control selections etc.
litematica.config.generic.comment.unhide:
Un-hides the Schematic VCS (Version Control System) menu button,
and enables the hotkey and the VCS functionality in general.
(This was called Schematic Projects before.)

In general you §6should not§r be using this feature,
unless you really know how it works and what it does.
It somewhat changes how the area selections, placements and pasting works,
in particular that there is also an area delete operation when pasting.

Basically this feature is intended for §6iterative, in-place§r design work,
and it allows you to easier create multiple versions/snapshots
of the same build, and also to switch between the versions by deleting what is
in the world first, and then pasting the next version in its place.
litematica.config.visuals.comment.enable: Main rendering toggle option. Enables/disables ALL mod rendering.

Enables schematic block rendering.
Disabling this allows you to only see the color overlay

The main toggle option for the schematic
block overlay rendering
Enable rendering the schematic and overlay
litematica.config.visuals.comment.render:
Maximum Schematic World Rendering Thread Size
This will directly effect overall multi-threaded performance

§6USE WITH CAUTION!! This will only take effect
§6after you leave the game, and rejoin.
litematica.config.visuals.comment.ghostB:
The alpha value of the ghost blocks,
when rendering them as translucent.
§6Note: §7You also need to enable the translucent rendering separately,
using the 'renderBlocksAsTranslucent' option!
litematica.config.visuals.comment.ignore:
If enabled, then any fluid blocks are ignored as "extra blocks"
and as "wrong blocks", ie. where the schematic has air or other blocks.
Basically this makes building stuff under water a whole lot less annoying.
Note: You will most likely also want to enable the 'renderCollidingSchematicBlocks'
option at the same time, to allow the blocks to get rendered inside fluids.
litematica.config.visuals.comment.overla:
If enabled, then the adjacent/touching inner sides
for the block overlays are removed/not rendered
litematica.config.visuals.comment.placem: The alpha value of the sub-region boxes' side
litematica.config.visuals.comment.render:
If enabled, then the area selection boxes will
have their side quads rendered

If enabled, then the schematics are rendered
using translucent "ghost blocks"

If enabled, then blocks in the schematics are rendered
also when there is already a (wrong) block in the client world.
Probably mostly useful when trying to build
something where there are snow layers or water in the way.

Render connecting lines between subsequent verifier hilight box corners.
This was a rendering bug that some people experienced, but at least some players
liked it and requested for it to stay, so this options "restores" it

If enabled, then the error markers in the Schematic Verifier
will have (translucent) sides rendered instead of just the outline

If enabled, then the placed schematic sub-region boxes
will have their side quads rendered

If enabled, then an enclosing box is rendered around
all the sub-regions in a schematic (placement)

If enabled, then the enclosing box around
a schematic placement will have its side quads rendered

If enabled, then the model sides are also rendered
for inner sides in the translucent mode
litematica.config.visuals.comment.schema:
Enables rendering a wire frame outline for
the schematic block overlay

Enables Translucent Sorting for
the schematic block overlay

Enables rendering translucent boxes/sides for
the schematic block overlay

If enabled, then the schematic overlay will use the
block model quads/vertices instead of the
traditional full block overlay

If enabled, then the schematic overlay will use the
block model quads/vertices instead of the
traditional full block overlay
The line width of the block (model) outlines

The line width of the block (model) outlines,
when the overlay is rendered through blocks

If enabled, then the schematic overlay will be rendered
through blocks. This is probably only useful once you are
finished building and want to see any errors easier
Enables the schematic overlay for extra blocks
Enables the schematic overlay for missing blocks
Enables the schematic overlay for wrong blocks
Enables the schematic overlay for wrong states

Forces using blocks models for everything in the Schematic Verifier
result list. Normally item models are used for anything
that has an item, and block models are only used for blocks
that don't have an item, plus for Flower Pots to see the contained item.
The alignment of the block info lines overlay
The alignment of the Block Info Overlay

The alignment of the "Info HUD",
used for the Material List, Schematic Verifier mismatch positions etc.
The alignment of the "tool HUD", when holding the configured "tool"

If enabled, then MiniHUD-style block info overlay
is rendered for the looked-at block
The font scale for the block info lines
The x offset of the block info lines from the selected edge
The y offset of the block info lines from the selected edge
The y offset of the block info overlay from the selected edge

Enable Block Info Overlay rendering to show info
about the looked-at block or verifier error marker,
while holding the 'renderInfoOverlay' key
The maximum number of info lines to show on the HUD at once
The X offset of the Info HUD from the screen edge
The Y offset of the Info HUD from the screen edge
Scale factor for the generic Info HUD text

When enabled, the Block Info Overlay and Block Info Lines
will be able to ray trace to fluid blocks instead of going through them

The maximum number of items to show on
the Material List Info HUD at once
Scale factor for the Material List Info HUD

Enable a status info HUD renderer,
which renders a few bits of status info, such as
the current layer mode and renderers enabled state

Allow automatically momentarily enabling the status info HUD "when needed",
for example when creating a placement and having rendering disabled
The X offset of the Info HUD from the screen edge
The Y offset of the Info HUD from the screen edge
Scale factor for the Tool HUD text
The alpha value of the error marker box sides

The maximum number of mismatched positions to render
at once in the Schematic Verifier overlay.
Enable Schematic Verifier marker overlay rendering

Should the warning message about being in a layer mode
or having some of the rendering options disabled
be shown when loading a new schematic
or creating a new placement
litematica.config.colors.comment.areaSel: The color of the area selection boxes, when they are unselected
litematica.config.colors.comment.hightli: The highlight color for the item of the looked at block
litematica.config.colors.comment.materia: The color of the item count text in the Material List info HUD
litematica.config.colors.comment.schemat: The color of Schematic Rebuild mode's break or place blocks selector overlay
The color of Schematic Rebuild mode's break all blocks except targeted selector overlay
The color of Schematic Rebuild mode's replace selector overlay
The color of the blocks overlay for extra blocks
The color of the blocks overlay for missing blocks
The color of the blocks overlay for wrong blocks
The color of the blocks overlay for wrong block states
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.addSel: Add a new selection box (position 1) here
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.cloneS:
Quickly clone the current area selection.
This basically just creates an in-memory-only schematic,
and then creates a placement of that schematic and selects it,
and also switches the tool mode to the Paste mode.
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.easyPl: When the easyPlaceMode is enabled, this key is used for placing the blocks
Allows quickly toggling on/off the Easy Place mode
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.execut:
Execute the currently selected tool operation with the
current selection or placement in the Fill, Replace,
Paste Schematic etc. modes
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.invert:
Inverts the schematic/ghost block rendering status
while this keybind is held down
Inverts the Overlay rendering status while this keybind is held down
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.layerM: Cycle the rendering mode (all, layers) forward
Cycle the rendering mode (all, layers) backwards
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.layerN: Move the rendered layer selection up
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.layerP: Move the rendered layer selection down
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.layerS: Set the Render Layer to the player's current position
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.nudgeS:
Nudge the current selection in the "negative" direction
This is basically the same as mouse wheel down
with the Nudge modifier pressed

Nudge the current selection in the "positive" direction
This is basically the same as mouse wheel up
with the Nudge modifier pressed
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.moveEn: Move the entire current selection here
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.openGu: Open the Area Settings GUI for the currently selected area

Open the Material List GUI for the currently
selected schematic placement

Open the Placement Settings GUI for the currently
selected placement or sub-region

Open the Schematic Verifier GUI for the currently
selected schematic placement
Open the Area Selection manager GUI
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.operat:
The modifier key to quickly change the operation mode.
Hold this and scroll while holding the "tool item" to quickly cycle the mode.
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.pickBl:
A key to pick block the first
schematic block ray traced to

A key to pick block the last schematic block
ray traced to, before the first (possible) client world
block ray traced to. Basically this would get
you the block you could place against an existing block.

A hotkey to toggle the pick block toggle option in the
Generic configs. This is provided as a quick way to enable
or disable the pick block keys, if they interfere with something.
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.render:
The key that enables rendering the block info overlay.
Use NONE for not requiring a key to be pressed.
Disable the similarly named option in the Visuals
configs to disable the overlay completely.

A hotkey to allow the overlays to render through blocks.
This is just a quicker way to temporarily enable
the same thing that the 'schematicOverlayRenderThroughBlocks' option in Visuals does.
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.rerend:
Hotkey to refresh/redraw only the schematic, instead of
having to refresh the vanilla terrain too with F3 + A
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.saveAr: Save the current Area Selection as an in-memory Schematic
Save the current Area Selection as a Schematic to a file
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.schema:
Modifier key to activate the "break everything except"
mode/function in the Schematic Edit tool mode.
Basically when you hold this key and punch a schematic block,
all other blocks except this block will be removed from the schematic.

Modifier key to activate the "break all identical blocks"
function in the Schematic Edit tool mode

Modifier key to activate the directional/continuous
break or place function in the Schematic Edit tool mode

Modifier key to activate the "replace all identical"
replace mode/function in the Schematic Edit tool mode

Modifier key to activate the "replace block type"
replace mode/function in the Schematic Edit tool mode

Modifier key to activate the directional/continuous
replace mode/function in the Schematic Edit tool mode

The modifier key to hold to be able to use the mouse wheel
to cycle through the schematic versions in the Version Control tool mode
A hotkey to cycle to the next schematic version in the Version Control tool mode
A hotkey to cycle to the next schematic version in the Version Control tool mode
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.select:
The modifier key to hold to "grab" a selection
box or corner for cursor moving.

The action hotkey to auto-grow the selection box around
any adjacent/diagonally connected blocks

The modifier key to hold to grow or shrink
a selection box while scrolling

The modifier key to hold while scrolling
to nudge the selected area or corner

Change the mode between Corners and Cuboid
in the Area Selection mode

The action hotkey to shrink the selection box so that there
isn't any empty space (empty layers) on any side
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.setAre:
Set/move the origin point of the current
area selection to the player's position
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.setSel:
Set the first position of the currently selected
box to the player's position

Set the second position of the currently selected
box to the player's position
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.toggle: Toggle Area Selection boxes rendering on/off
Toggle the info overlay rendering (for hovered block info)
Toggle the block overlay rendering on/off
Toggle the block overlay outline rendering on/off
Toggle the block overlay side rendering on/off
Toggle Schematic Placement boxes rendering on/off
A hotkey to toggle the placement restriction mode
Toggle the signTextPaste config value (in Generic category)
Toggle translucent vs. opaque ghost block rendering
Toggle the Schematic Verifier overlay rendering
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.toolEn: The keybind to toggle the "tool" item functionality on/off
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.toolPl:
The button to use while holding the "tool" item
to place the primary/first corner

The button to use while holding the "tool" item
to place the second corner
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.toolSe:
The button to use to select corners or boxes
while holding the "tool" item

The modifier key to hold while using the 'toolSelectElements'
hotkey, to select the primary block type to use in some of the tool modes

The modifier key to hold while using the 'toolSelectElements'
hotkey, to select the secondary block type to use in some of the tool modes
litematica.config.hotkeys.comment.unload: Unloads the schematic of the currently selected placement,and thus also removes all placements created from it
litematica.error.area_selection.create_f: Не удалось создать новое выделение с именем '%s', файл уже существует
litematica.error.area_selection.rename.a: Ошибка: область с именем '%s' уже существует
litematica.error.duplicate_schematic_pla: Ошибка: Попытка создать уже существующее размещение
litematica.error.generic.creative_mode_o: Это действие доступно только в режиме креатива
litematica.error.generic.failed_to_sort_: Не удалось отсортировать список игнорируемых состояний
litematica.error.area_editor.open_gui.no: Активен режим выделения: обычный, но не выбрана ни одна область
litematica.error.area_editor.rename_sub_:
Не удалось переименовать подрегион:
Подрегион уже существует с именем '%s'
litematica.error.area_editor.switch_mode: Не удалось переключить режим указания на обычный, так как не выбрана область. Выберите область или создайте новое выделение в Менеджере областей выделения
litematica.error.schematic_conversion.st: Ошибка конвертации структуры в схему Litematica
litematica.error.schematic.create.no_sel: Выделение не имеет ни одного подрегиона.
litematica.error.schematic_load.cant_rea: Не удалось прочитать файл схемы '%s' (ошибка доступа или файл не существует)
litematica.error.schematic_load.no_schem: Схема не содержит информации о версии и не может быть безопасно загружена.
litematica.error.schematic_load.unsuppor: Неподдерживаемая или более поздняя версия схемы "%d"
litematica.error.schematic_manager.schem: Только схемы Litematica могут быть экспортированы в другие форматы.
Тип выбранной схемы не поддерживается для импорта.
litematica.error.schematic_placements.re: Размещение зафиксировано. Удерживайте Shift, чтобы принудительно удалить его.
litematica.error.schematic_read_from_fil: Не удалось прочитать схему из файла '%s'
Исключение при попытке чтения схемы из файла '%s'
Не удалось прочитать схему из файла: файл недоступен (возможно, временная схема?)

litematica.info.schematic_manager.previe:
- Нажмите ПКМ по кнопке, чтобы прервать операцию создания миниатюры
- Удерживайте Ctrl+Alt+Shift при нажатии, чтобы загрузить картинку из существующего
 PNG-файла с именем "thumb.png", лежащего в той же директории, что и файл схемы.
Используйте обычную клавишу создания скриншота, чтобы установить миниатюру. Нажмите ПКМ по этой кнопке, чтобы прервать операцию.
Удерживайте Shift, чтобы сохранить временную схему (только в ОЗУ)
litematica.gui.button.hover.area_selecti: Снимает выбор с текущей области выделения
litematica.gui.button.hover.material_lis:
Очищает кэш материалов.
Обычно это не требуется.
Это можно использовать вместо удаления файла "material_cache.nbt"
в случае, если кэш содержит ошибочные данные вроде
предметов, сохранённых для блоков, которые их не имеют
(например, головка поршня)

Удерживайте Shift для записи в файл .ctv
вместо обычной ASCII-таблицы в текстовом файле.
Удерживайте Shift, чтобы выбрать подрегионы для списка материалов
litematica.gui.button.hover.plus_minus_t:
ЛКМ для увеличения
ПКМ для уменьшения
Shift и/или Alt для увеличения размера шага

ЛКМ для увеличения
ПКМ для уменьшения
Shift/Alt/Ctrl для умножения размера шага
litematica.gui.button.hover.schematic_li:
Перезагружает схему из файла.
Может быть полезно, если вы безвозвратно
повредили схему в режиме редактирования.
litematica.gui.button.hover.schematic_pr:
Сейчас открыт проект управления версиями схемы.
Режим УВС переопределяет обычный функционал
областей выделения.

(Ранее назывался "Проекты схем")
Вам §6не следует§r использовать эту функцию,
если вы не знаете, как она работает и что делает.
Она несколько изменяет способ работы выделения
областей, размещения и вставки. Например, при
вставке выполняется операция удаления области.

Эта функция предназначается для §6итеративной работы§r
с дизайном §6на одном и том же месте§r и позволяет вам
легко создавать несколько версий/набросков какой-либо
постройки и переключаться между ними, удаляя блоки
на месте старой версии постройки и замещая их новой.

Переместить точку привязки проекта к текущей пощиции игрока.
Это также переместит область выделения и размещение.

§6Предупреждение: Это приведёт к замене блоков
§6в пределах области, сохранённой как версия проекта
§6или размещённой из неё.
Сохранить новую версию проекта (в виде схемы)
litematica.gui.button.schematic_placemen:
Фиксация размещения предотвращает его сдвиг
или иное случайное изменение позиции

Отображение: %s
Обратите внимание, что это работает немного
странно и не влияет на отображение сущностей.
Обычно достаточно просто полностью
отключить размещение.

litematica.gui.label.schematic_info.name: Название:
litematica.gui.label.schematic_placement: Удерживайте Shift, чтобы скрыть размещение при создании
litematica.gui.label.schematic_save.hove: Удерживайте Shift, чтобы перезаписать существующий файл
litematica.gui.message.schematic_project: Вы хотите удалить последнюю затронутую область? Это приведёт к удалению всех блоков и сущностей, находящихся в области, которую менеджер проекта в последний раз размещал в мире или сохранял в качестве версии. (Как правило, "последняя просмотренная затронутая область", если бы вы циклично перебирали версии, она не оставила бы блоков после предыдущей версии.)

Вы хотите разместить эту версию в мире? Это приведёт к удалению всех блоков, находящихся в области, которую менеджер проекта в последний раз размещал в мире или сохранял в качестве версии. (Как правило, "последняя просмотренная затронутая область", если бы вы циклично перебирали версии, она не оставила бы блоков после предыдущей версии.)
litematica.gui.title.create_area_selecti: Создать новую область выделения из размещения схемы
litematica.gui.title.create_schematic_fr: Сохранить текущую выбранную область как схему
litematica.hud.misc.renderer_status: Отображение: A: %s Блоки: %s B: %s Обводка: %s Области: %s
litematica.hud.schematic_placement.hover:
Зафиксировать координату
Это позволяет менять другие координаты,
не затрагивая зафиксированную.

Это размещение зафиксировано и не может
быть изменено без снятия фиксации
litematica.info.material_list:
- Клавиша списка материалов откроет последний просмотренный список материалов,
   если он был сохранён.
- Чтобы переключиться на другой список материалов, откройте его
   с помощью соответствующей кнопки в окне настроек размещения
   или в Менеджере схем.
- Сохранённый/просмотренный список также "забывается",
   если меняется размещение выбранной схемы.
- Если ещё нет последнего просмотренного списка материалов,
   то используется выбранное размещение (при наличии)

litematica.message.error.move.pending_ta: §cНе удаётся запустить операцию перемещения, пока есть незавершённые задачи§r

Сохранение схемы привело к ошибке или было остановлено
§cНе удалось сохранить схему - не выбрана область§r
litematica.message.warn.pickblock.no_sui:
Не найден подходящий слот панели быстрого доступа для блока выбора!
Проверьте конфигурацию Generic -> §epickBlockableSlots§r.
Кроме того, в зависимости от конфигурации §epickBlockAvoid*§6, функция блока выбора может отказаться заменять любые инструменты или другие повреждаемые элементы в этих слотах.
litematica.message.warn.pickblock.no_val: В конфигурации Generic -> §epickBlockableSlots§6 не установлены слоты для горячей панели!
litematica.message.litematic_saved_as:
Успешно обновлена ​​версия данных Litematica Schematic.
Схема сохранена как '%s'
litematica.message.paste_with_servux: §6Место размещения загружается в Servux для вставки.
litematica.message.placement.cant_modify: §cРазмещение зафиксировано и не может быть перемещено§r
litematica.message.schematic_pasted_usin: Схема вставлена с использованием §b%s§r команд //set для World Edit
Схема вставлена с использованием §b%s§r команд /fill и §b%s§r команд /setblock
litematica.message.warn.area_selection.b: Примечание: В настоящее время вы в режиме простого выделения области
litematica.message.warn.layer_mode_curre: Примечание: В настоящее время включён режим отображения §f[%s]
litematica.message.warn.main_rendering_d: Внимание: В настоящее время отображение всех элементов отключено. Проверьте настройки §f[Визуализация] §6→§f %s§6 или §f[Клавиши] §6→§f %s [%s]
litematica.message.warn.schematic_blocks: Внимание: Отображение блоков в схеме в настоящее время отключено. Проверьте настройки §f[Визуализация] §6→§f %s§6 или §f[Клавиши] §6→§f %s [%s]
litematica.message.warn.schematic_load_n: Предупреждение: При прямой загрузке схем, отличающихся от формата Litematica, созданные размещения не будут постоянными. Кроме того, преобразование типа схемы будет вызывать зависание каждый раз, когда вы её загружаете (особенно для больших схем). Поэтому рекомендуется импортировать схему и сохранить её в формате Litematica через Диспетчер схем, но лучше вставить исходную схему во временный мир с помощью MCEdit или режима вставки в Litematica, а затем создать из неё новую схему Litematica, по возможности используя несколько подрегионов для плотного захвата постройки, где это применимо.
litematica.message.warn.schematic_rebuil: Это размещение сейчас не выбрано. Клавиша "Заменить всё" работает только с выделенными подрегионами размещения, на которое вы нажимаете. Поэтому, чтобы заменить блоки в конкретном подрегионе, выберите этот подрегион. Чтобы произвести замену во всей схеме (все подрегионы), выберите всё размещение, но не отдельный подрегион. Также блоки будут заменены только в пределах отображаемых слоёв.
litematica.message.warn.schematic_render: Внимание: В настоящее время отображение схемы отключено. Проверьте настройки §f[Визуализация] §6→§f %s§6 или §f[Клавиши] §6→§f %s [%s]
litematica.message.warn.schematic_verifi: Внимание: Наложение информации проверки схемы отключено. Проверьте настройки §f[Наложение информации] §6→§f %s§6 (или §f[Клавиши] §6→§f %s [%s]§6)
litematica.message.warning.schematic_pro: Внимание: Система управления версиями схемы (УВС) скрыта. Вам НЕ следует её использовать, если вы не знаете, каким образом она работает и меняет поведение мода. Она предназначена для работы в местах, где требуется быстрое переключение по итерациям между разными версиями постройки (=удаление предыдущей версии и её замена новой). Если вы хотите её использовать, включите настройку [Основные] → unhideSchematicVCS
litematica.warning.area_editor.area_rend: Примечание: В настоящее время отображение регионов областей выделения отключено. Проверьте настройки §f[Визуализация] §6→§f %s§6 или §f[Клавиши] §6→§f %s [%s]
litematica.tool_mode.name.grid_paste: Вставка схемы в мир по сетке
